Generation I.Red: When several of these Pok é mon gather, their electricity could build and cause lightning storms.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: When several of these Pok é mon gather, their electricity could build and cause lightning storms.
Generation I.Yellow: It keeps its tail raised to monitor its surroundings. If you yank its tail, it will try to bite you.
Generation I.Stadium: Lives in forests away from people. It stores electricity in its cheeks for zapping an enemy if it is attacked.

Generation II.Gold: This intelligent Pok é mon roasts hard Berries with electricity to make them tender enough to eat.
Generation II.Silver: It raises its tail to check its surroundings. The tail is sometimes struck by lightning in this pose.
Generation II.Crystal: When it is angered, it immediately discharges the energy stored in the pouches in its cheeks.
Generation II.Stadium 2: This intelligent Pok é mon roasts hard Berries with electricity to make them tender enough to eat. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) It raises its tail to check its surroundings. The tail is sometimes struck by lightning in this pose. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Whenever Pikachu comes across something new, it blasts it with a jolt of electricity. If you come across a blackened berry, it's evidence that this Pok é mon mistook the intensity of its charge.
Generation III.Sapphire: This Pok é mon has electricity-storing pouches on its cheeks. These appear to become electrically charged during the night while Pikachu sleeps. It occasionally discharges electricity when it is dozy after waking up.
Generation III.Emerald: It stores electricity in the electric sacs on its cheeks. When it releases pent-up energy in a burst, the electric power is equal to a lightning bolt.
Generation III.FireRed: It has small electric sacs on both its cheeks. If threatened, it looses electric charges from the sacs.
Generation III.LeafGreen: When several of these Pok é mon gather, their electricity can build and cause lightning storms.

Generation IV.Diamond: It lives in forests with others. It stores electricity in the pouches on its cheeks.
Generation IV.Pearl: If it looses crackling power from the electric pouches on its cheeks, it is being wary.
Generation IV.Platinum: It occasionally uses an electric shock to recharge a fellow Pikachu that is in a weakened state.
Generation IV.HeartGold: This intelligent Pokémon roasts hard berries with electricity to make them tender enough to eat.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: It raises its tail to check its surroundings. The tail is sometimes struck by lightning in this pose.

Generation V.Black: It occasionally uses an electric shock to recharge a fellow Pikachu that is in a weakened state.
Generation V.White: It occasionally uses an electric shock to recharge a fellow Pikachu that is in a weakened state.
Generation V.Black 2: It occasionally uses an electric shock to recharge a fellow Pikachu that is in a weakened state.
Generation V.White 2: It occasionally uses an electric shock to recharge a fellow Pikachu that is in a weakened state.

Generation VI.X: It raises its tail to check its surroundings. The tail is sometimes struck by lightning in this pose.
Generation VI.Y: It has small electric sacs on both its cheeks. If threatened, it looses electric charges from the sacs.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Whenever Pikachu comes across something new, it blasts it with a jolt of electricity. If you come across a blackened berry, it's evidence that this Pokémon mistook the intensity of its charge.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: This Pokémon has electricity-storing pouches on its cheeks. These appear to become electrically charged during the night while Pikachu sleeps. It occasionally discharges electricity when it is dozy after waking up.

Generation VII.Sun: This form of Pikachu is somewhat rare. It wears the hat of its Trainer, who is also its partner.
Generation VII.Moon: This Pikachu is wearing its Trainer's cap. Since the cap's not the right size, the fit is a bit loose.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: This form of Pikachu is somewhat rare. It wears the hat of its Trainer, who is also its partner.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: This Pikachu is wearing its Trainer's cap. Since the cap's not the right size, the fit is a bit loose.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: This forest-dwelling Pokémon stores electricity in its cheeks, so you'll feel a tingly shock if you touch it.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: This forest-dwelling Pokémon stores electricity in its cheeks, so you'll feel a tingly shock if you touch it.

Generation VIII.Sword: This Pikachu wears its partner's cap, which is brimming with memories of traveling through different regions.
Generation VIII.Shield: This Pikachu is wearing its Trainer's cap. The cap is a precious symbol that travels across different regions with Pikachu.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It lives in forests with others. It stores electricity in the electric sacs on its cheeks.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: If it looses crackling power from the electric sacs on its cheeks, it is being wary.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Possesses cheek sacs in which it stores electricity. This clever forest-dweller roasts tough berries with an electric shock before consuming them.

Generation IX.Scarlet: The cap this Pikachu wears is filled with memories of this Pokémon and its partner traveling across the world together.
Generation IX.Violet: This Pikachu wears its partner's cap—proof of the strong bond Pikachu and its partner formed during adventures across the world.

Generation I.Blue (Japan): Viridian Forest , Power Plant , Rocket Game Corner
Generation I.Yellow: First Pokémon from Professor Oak in Pallet Town

Generation II.Crystal: Route 2 Morning Day , Celadon Game Corner

Generation IV.SoulSilver: Viridian Forest Trade Pikachu in Saffron City
Generation IV.Pokéwalker: Resort , Yellow Forest , Rally , and Sightseeing

Generation VI.Y: Santalune Forest , Route 3 , Friend Safari ( Electric )

Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Safari Zone (Zone 1, long grass ) Received at the Contest Hall in Verdanturf Town , Fallarbor Town , Slateport City , or Lilycove City after first Pokémon Contest ( Cosplay Pikachu )

Generation VIII.Shield: Route 4 , Stony Wilderness Rolling Fields ( Wanderer ) Giant's Cap , Giant's Mirror , Hammerlocke Hills , Lake of Outrage , Motostoke Riverbank ( Max Raid Battle ) Meetup Spot ( Only one ) * ( Gigantamax Factor )
